abstract.p: A transmission system has an input connected to a drive source, and an output connected to a load. The transmission system further has a transmission that includes two input shafts and an output shaft, as well as a clutch module comprising a clutch and a planetary gear set which comprises three rotational members of which a first rotational member is connected to the input, a second rotational member is coupled to the output and a third rotational member is connected to a brake. Between the input shafts and the output shaft are located three speed transforming gears and three gear clutches, and between the two input shafts is located a further clutch.

description.p:
The invention relates to a transmission system for a vehicle, having an input which can be connected to a drive source, and an output which can be connected to a load, and comprising:
a transmission comprising a transmission housing having a first input shaft, and an output shaft connected to the output, where a first switchable speed transforming gear is present between the first input shaft and the output shaft,
a clutch having a first clutch section which is connected to the input, and a second clutch section which is connected to the first input shaft of the transmission, and
a planetary gear set comprising at least three rotational members of which a first rotational member is connected to the input, a second rotational member is coupled to the output, and a third rotational member is connected to a brake.

A transmission system of this type is known from EP-A-1 625 037. When applied to a vehicle, the speed transforming gear of the transmission may be changed with the transmission system known from this publication without the torque transfer from the drive source to the wheels being interrupted by actuation of the brake. The module forming part of this known transmission system is pre-eminently suitable for application to existing transmissions. With a slight modification of the clutch the module may be installed between the clutch and the transmission and then be placed in parallel with the transmission or in parallel with the transmission and the clutch.

It is an object of the invention to provide a transmission system of the type defined in the opening paragraph which is more cost-effective than the known transmission system and with which even without an interruption of the torque transfer from the drive source to the wheels a switch may be made between two or more speed transforming gears. For this purpose, the transmission system according to the invention is characterised in that the transmission further includes a second input shaft where a second switchable speed transforming gear is present between the second input shaft and the output shaft, and where the second rotational member of the planetary gear set is connected to the second input shaft. The transmission system according to the invention can be used in a vehicle in lieu of a transmission and a clutch and in a simpler and more cost-effective way than the known transmission system because the transmission needs to include fewer speed transforming gears to still be able to realize different transmission ratios in equal measure.
The planetary gear set may be present in a space that is located between the transmission housing and a partition affixed to the outside of the transmission housing.

Preferably, however, the planetary gear set is not present in a space that is located between the transmission housing and a partition affixed to the outside of the transmission housing. The planetary gear set is preferably located inside the transmission housing where the planetary gear set may be located in a sub-space separated from the transmission by a partition if any. The planetary gear set may also be located outside the transmission housing in a separate wet or dry space.

The further embodiments of the transmission system according to the invention and mentioned hereinafter all add to optimization of the transmission system in as simple and cost-effective manner as possible, where compactness and weight of the system plays an important role.
The transmission ratios of the planetary gear set and the transmission are preferably selected such that the lowest forward gear of the transmission system can be attained by closing the brake.

An advantageous embodiment of the transmission system is characterised in that the first and the second rotational member can be coupled directly to each other by means of the clutch and a further clutch connected in series thereto, without the use of a further speed transforming gear.
Preferably, the further clutch is then located in the transmission between the first and the second input shaft.
The further clutch can then directly couple the first and the second input shaft to each other without the use of a further speed transforming gear.

In yet a further embodiment a first gear clutch is located between the first input shaft and the output shaft of the transmission. This first gear clutch is preferably located between the first speed transforming gear and the output shaft.

In again a further embodiment a second gear clutch is located between the second input shaft and the output shaft of the transmission. This second gear clutch is preferably located between the second input shaft and the second speed transforming gear.

In still a further embodiment a third speed transforming gear and a third gear clutch are located between the first input shaft and the output shaft of the transmission. This third gear clutch is preferably located between the third speed transforming gear and the output shaft.

A further advantageous embodiment of the transmission system is characterised in that the second speed transforming gear forms the third gear if the third rotational member of the planetary gear set is braked and the second gear clutch is closed.

Ye a further advantageous embodiment of the transmission system is characterised in that the first speed transforming gear forms the first gear if the third rotational member of the planetary gear set is braked and the further clutch and the first gear clutch are closed.
In another embodiment the first speed transforming gear forms the second gear if the clutch and the first gear clutch are closed.

In a further embodiment the third speed transforming gear forms the fourth gear if the third rotational member of the planetary gear set is braked and the further clutch and the third gear clutch are closed.
In another embodiment the third speed transforming gear forms the fourth gear if the clutch and the third gear clutch are closed.
In yet another embodiment the third speed transforming gear forms the fifth gear if the clutch and the third gear clutch are closed.

A still further advantageous embodiment of the transmission system is characterised in that a reverse gear is present between one of the input shafts and the output shaft of the transmission, which reverse gear does not reverse the direction of rotation between this input shaft and the output shaft of the transmission.

The invention will be described hereinbelow in more detail based on an example of embodiment of the transmission system according to the invention represented in the drawing figures, in which:
Fig. 1 gives a diagrammatic representation of an embodiment of the transmission system according to the invention; and
Fig. 2 gives a concrete lay out of the transmission system represented in Fig. 1.

Figs. 1 and 2 represent an embodiment of the transmission system according to the invention in a diagrammatic and concrete manner respectively. The transmission system 1 comprises an input 3 which is connected to a drive source E, and an output 5 which is connected to a load L by means of a differental gear D. The load is formed by the wheels of a vehicle. The transmission system further includes a transmission 7 having a transmission housing 8 with a first and a second input shaft 9 and 11 and an output shaft 13 which is connected to the output 5. Although the end drive with the differential gear D is shown outside the drawing Figure in the diagrammatic representation of Fig. 1, the end drive is located in the transmission housing 8, as is concretely shown in Fig. 2

The transmission system 1 further includes a clutch module 15 comprising a clutch C and a planetary gear set 17. The clutch comprises a first clutch section c1 which is connected to the input 3, and a second clutch section c2 which is connected to the first input shaft 9 of the transmission. The planetary gear set 17 comprises three rotational members of which a first rotational member r1, which is formed by a ring gear, is connected to the input 3, a second rotational member r2, which is formed by a planet carrier, is coupled to the output 5 via the transmission 7, and a third rotational member r3, which is formed by a sun gear and is connected to a brake B. The transmission ratio between the first and the second rotational member r1 and r2 is found between a value 1 and 2, retarding toward the output, when the third rotational member r3 is braked. And the transmission ratios of the planetary gear set 17 and the transmission 7 are selected such that the lowest forward gear of the transmission system 1 can be attained by closing the brake B.

The planetary gear set 17 is not located in a wet space affixed to the transmission housing 8, but in this embodiment is a grease lubricated gear set. The clutch C is a wet or dry plate friction clutch which is normally closed by means of spring force, and the brake B is a wet or dry plate friction brake which is normally open.

A sub transmission 21 and 23 is present between each input shaft 9 and 11 and the output shaft 13 of the transmission 7. The first sub transmission 21 comprises a first speed transforming gear i1 and a first gear clutch s1 which is present between the first speed transforming gear i1 and the output shaft 13, as well as a third speed tranforming gear i3 and a third gear clutch s3 which is present between the third speed transforming gear i3 and the output shaft 13. The second sub transmission 23 comprises a second speed transforming gear i2 and a second gear clutch s2 which is present between the second speed transforming gear i2 and the second input shaft 11.

Between the two input shafts 9 and 11 there is located a further clutch s which can directly couple these two shafts to each other. The further clutch s and the gear clutches s1, s2 and s3 are arranged as synchronised claw clutches.

The speed transforming gears may be selected such that the first speed transforming gear i1 forms the first gear if the third rotational member r3 of the planetary gear set 17 is braked and the further clutch s and the first speed transforming gear s1 are closed, and that the second speed transforming gear i2 forms the third gear if the third rotational member r3 of the planetary gear set 17 is braked and the second gear clutch s2 is closed. Furthermore, the first speed transforming gear i1 forms the second gear if the clutch C and the first gear clutch s1 are closed.

The third speed transforming gear i3 can form the fourth gear if the third rotational member r3 of the planetary gear set 17 is braked and the further clutch s and the third speed transforming gear s3 are closed, or if the clutch C and the third gear clutch s3 are closed. And the third speed transforming gear i3 can form the fifth gear if the clutch C and the third gear clutch s3 are closed.

Furthermore, a reverse gear i4 (represented in Fig. 2 only) may be present between one of the input shafts, in this example the first input shaft 9, and the output shaft 13, which reverse gear i4 does not reverse the direction of rotation between this input shaft and the output shaft of the transmission.

Albeit the invention has been described in the foregoing based on the drawings, it should be observed that the invention is not by any manner or means restricted to the embodiment shown in the drawings. The invention also extends to all embodiments deviating from the embodiment shown in the drawings within the scope defined by the claims.

claim.claim-text:
Getriebesystem (1) für ein Fahrzeug, versehen mit einem Getriebeeingang (3), der mit einer Antriebsquelle (E) verbunden werden kann, und einem Getriebeausgang (5), der mit einer Last (L) verbunden werden kann, wobei das Getriebesystem Folgendes umfasst: - ein Getriebe (7), das mit einem Getriebegehäuse (8) mit einer ersten Eingangswelle (9) sowie mit einer mit dem Getriebeausgang verbundenen Ausgangswelle (13) versehen ist, wobei zwischen der ersten Eingangswelle und der Ausgangswelle eine erste schaltbare Getriebestufe (i1) vorhanden ist, - eine Kupplung (C) mit einer mit dem Getriebeeingang verbundenen ersten Kupplungsteil (c1) und einem zweiten Kupplungsteil (c2), der mit der ersten Eingangswelle des Getriebes verbunden ist, und - ein Planetengetriebe (17) mit mindestens drei Drehkörpern, von denen ein erster Drehkörper (r1) mit dem Getriebeeingang, ein zweiter Drehkörper (r2) mit dem Getriebeausgang und ein dritter Drehkörper (r3) mit einer Bremse (B) verbunden ist,
dadurch gekennzeichnet, dass das Getriebe (7) ferner eine zweite Eingangswelle (11) umfasst, wobei zwischen der zweiten Eingangswelle und der Ausgangswelle (13) eine zweite schaltbare Getriebestufe (i2) vorhanden ist und wobei der zweite Drehkörper (r2) des Planetengetriebes (17) mit der zweiten Eingangswelle verbunden ist.

Getriebesystem (1) nach Anspruch 1, dadurch gekennzeichnet, dass das Planetengetriebe nicht in einem Raum angeordnet ist, der sich zwischen dem Getriebegehäuse (8) und einer an der Außenseite des Getriebegehäuses angebrachten Wand befindet.

Getriebesystem (1) nach einem der Ansprüche 1 oder 2, dadurch gekennzeichnet, dass die Übersetzungsverhältnisse des Planetengetriebes (17) und des Getriebes (7) so gewählt sind, dass der niedrigste Vorwärtsgang des Getriebesystems erreicht werden kann, indem die Bremse (B) aktiviert wird.

Getriebesystem (1) nach einem der Ansprüche 1, 2 oder 3, dadurch gekennzeichnet, dass sich der erste und der zweite Drehkörper (r1, r2) über eine Kupplung (C) und eine in Serie zu dieser angeordneten weiteren Kupplung (s) ohne den Einsatz einer weiteren Getriebestufe direkt miteinander koppeln lassen.
Getriebesystem (1) nach Anspruch 4, dadurch gekennzeichnet, dass die weitere Kupplung (s) in dem Getriebe (7) zwischen der ersten und der zweiten Eingangswelle (9, 11) angeordnet ist.

Getriebesystem (1) nach einem der Ansprüche 4 oder 5, dadurch gekennzeichnet, dass die erste und die zweite Eingangswelle (9, 11) des Getriebes (7) von der weiteren Kupplung (s) ohne den Einsatz einer weiteren Getriebestufe direkt miteinander gekoppelt werden können.
Getriebesystem (1) nach Anspruch 6, dadurch gekennzeichnet, dass zwischen der ersten Eingangswelle (9) und der Ausgangswelle (13) des Getriebes (7) eine erste Zahnradkupplung (s1) angeordnet ist.
Getriebesystem (1) nach Anspruch 7, dadurch gekennzeichnet, dass die erste Zahnradkupplung (s1) zwischen der ersten Getriebestufe (i1) und der Ausgangswelle (13) angeordnet ist.

Getriebesystem (1) nach einem der Ansprüche 7 oder 8, dadurch gekennzeichnet, dass zwischen der zweiten Eingangswelle (11) und der Ausgangswelle (13) des Getriebes (7) eine zweite Zahnradkupplung (s2) angeordnet ist.
Getriebesystem (1) nach Anspruch 9, dadurch gekennzeichnet, dass die zweite Zahnradkupplung (s2) zwischen der zweiten Eingangswelle (11) und der zweiten Getriebestufe (i2) angeordnet ist.

Getriebesystem (1) nach einem der Ansprüche 9 oder 10, dadurch gekennzeichnet, dass zwischen der ersten Eingangswelle (9) und der Ausgangswelle (13) des Getriebes (7) ferner eine dritte Getriebestufe (i3) und eine dritte Zahnradkupplung (s3) angeordnet sind.
Getriebesystem (1) nach Anspruch 11, dadurch gekennzeichnet, dass die dritte Zahnradkupplung (s3) zwischen der dritten Getriebestufe (i3) und der Ausgangswelle (13) angeordnet ist.

Getriebesystem (1) nach einem der Ansprüche 11 oder 12, dadurch gekennzeichnet, dass die zweite Getriebestufe (i2) den dritten Gang bildet, wenn der dritte Drehkörper (r3) des Planetengetriebes (17) abgebremst wird und die zweite Zahnradkupplung (s2) geschlossen ist.

Getriebesystem (1) nach einem der Ansprüche 11, 12 oder 13, dadurch gekennzeichnet, dass die erste Getriebestufe (i1) den ersten Gang bildet, wenn der dritte Drehkörper (r3) des Planetengetriebes (17) abgebremst wird und die weitere Kupplung (s) und die erste Zahnradkupplung (s1) geschlossen sind,
und/oder dass die erste Getriebestufe (i1) den zweiten Gang bildet, wenn die Kupplung (c) und die erste Zahnradkupplung (s1) geschlossen sind,
und/oder dass die dritte Getriebestufe (i3) den vierten Gang bildet, wenn der dritte Drehkörper (r3) des Planetengetriebes (17) abgebremst wird und die weitere Kupplung (s) und die dritte Zahnradkupplung (s3) geschlossen sind,
und/oder dass die dritte Getriebestufe (i3) den vierten Gang bildet, wenn die Kupplung (C) und die dritte Zahnradkupplung (s3) geschlossen sind,
und/oder dass die dritte Getriebestufe (i3) den fünften Gang bildet, wenn die Kupplung (C) und die dritte Zahnradkupplung (s3) geschlossen sind.

Getriebesystem (1) nach einem der vorangegangenen Ansprüche, dadurch gekennzeichnet, dass zwischen einer der Eingangswellen (9, 11) und der Ausgangswelle (13) des Getriebes (7) ein Rückwärtsgang (i4) vorhanden ist, durch den die Drehrichtung zwischen dieser Eingangswelle und der Ausgangswelle des Getriebes nicht geändert wird.

A transmission system (1) for a vehicle, having an input (3) which can be connected to a drive source (E), and an output (5) which can be connected to a load (L), and comprising: - a transmission (7) comprising a transmission housing (8) having a first input shaft (9), and an output shaft (13) connected to the output, where a first switchable speed transforming gear (i1) is present between the first input shaft and the output shaft, - a clutch (C) having a first clutch section (c1) which is connected to the input, and a second clutch section (c2) which is connected to the first input shaft of the transmission, and - a planetary gear set (17) comprising at least three rotational members of which a first rotational member (r1) is connected to the input, a second rotational member (r2) is coupled to the output, and a third rotational member (r3) is connected to a brake (B), characterised in that the transmission (7) further includes a second input shaft (11) where a second switchable speed transforming gear (i2) is present between the second input shaft and the output shaft (13), and where the second rotational member (r2) of the planetary gear set (17) is connected to the second input shaft.

A transmission system (1) as claimed in claim 1, characterised in that the planetary gear set is not present in a space that is located between the transmission housing (8) and a partition affixed to the outside of the transmission housing.

A transmission system (1) as claimed in claim 1 or 2, characterised in that the transmission ratios of the planetary gear set (17) and the transmission (7) are selected such that the lowest forward gear of the transmission system can be attained by closing the brake (B).

A transmission system (1) as claimed in claim 1, 2 or 3, characterised in that the first and the second rotational member (r1, r2) can be coupled directly to each other by means of the clutch (C) and a further clutch (s) connected in series thereto, without the use of a further speed transforming gear.
A transmission system (1) as claimed in claim 4, characterised in that the further clutch (s) is located in the transmission (7) between the first and the second input shaft (9, 11).

A transmission system (1) as claimed in claim 4 or 5, characterised in that the further clutch (s) can directly couple the first and the second input shaft (9, 11) of the transmission (7) to each other without the use of a further speed transforming gear.
A transmission system (1) as claimed in claim 6, characterised in that a first gear clutch (s1) is located between the first input shaft (9) and the output shaft (13) of the transmission (7).
A transmission system (1) as claimed in claim 7, characterised in that the first gear clutch (s1) is located between the first speed transforming gear (i1) and the output shaft (13).
A transmission system (1) as claimed in claim 7 or 8, characterised in that a second gear clutch (s2) is located between the second input shaft (11) and the output shaft (13) of the transmission (7).
A transmission system (1) as claimed in claim 9, characterised in that the second gear clutch (s2) is located between the second input shaft (11) and the second speed transforming gear (i2).

A transmission system (1) as claimed in claim 9 or 10, characterised in that a third speed transforming gear (i3) and a third gear clutch (s3) are located between the first input shaft (9) and the output shaft (13) of the transmission (7).
A transmission system (1) as claimed in claim 11, characterised in that the third gear clutch (s3) is located between the third speed transforming gear (i3) and the output shaft (13).

A transmission system (1) as claimed in claim 11 or 12, characterised in that the second speed transforming gear (i2) forms the third gear if the third rotational member (r3) of the planetary gear set (17) is braked and the second gear clutch (s2) is closed.

A transmission system (1) as claimed in claim 11, 12 or 13, characterised in that the first speed transforming gear (i1) forms the first gear if the third rotational member (r3) of the planetary gear set (17) is braked and the further clutch (s) and the first gear clutch (s1) are closed,
and/or in that the first speed transforming gear (i1) forms the second gear if the clutch (c) and the first gear clutch (s1) are closed,
and/or in that the third speed transforming gear (i3) forms the fourth gear if the third rotational member (r3) of the planetary gear set (17) is braked and the further clutch (s) and the third gear clutch (s3) are closed,
and/or in that the third speed transforming gear (i3) forms the fourth gear if the clutch (C) and the third gear clutch (s3) are closed,
and/or in that the third speed transforming gear (i3) forms the fifth gear if the clutch (C) and the third gear clutch (s3) are closed.

A transmission system (1) as claimed in any one of the preceding claims, characterised in that a reverse gear (i4) is present between one of the input shafts (9, 11) and the output shaft (13) of the transmission (7), which reverse gear (i4) does not reverse the direction of rotation between this input shaft and the output shaft of the transmission.

Système de transmission (1) pour un véhicule, pourvu d'une entrée (3) pouvant être reliée à une source motrice (E), et d'une sortie (5) pouvant être reliée à une charge (L), et comprenant: - une transmission (7) pourvue d'un carter de transmission (8) ayant un premier axe entrant (9) et un axe sortant (13) relié à la sortie, où un premier rapport de vitesses commutable (i1) se trouve entre le premier axe entrant et l'axe sortant, - un embrayage (C) ayant une première partie d'embrayage (c1) reliée à l'entrée, et une deuxième partie d'embrayage (c2) reliée au premier axe entrant de la transmission, et - un rapport de vitesses planétaire (17) ayant au moins trois corps rotatifs dont un premier corps rotatif (r1) est relié à l'entrée, un deuxième corps rotatif (r2) est couplé à la sortie, et un troisième corps rotatif (r3) est relié à un frein (B),
caractérisé en ce que la transmission (7) comprend de plus un deuxième axe entrant (11), où un deuxième rapport de vitesses commutable (i2) se trouve entre le deuxième axe entrant et l'axe sortant (13), et où le deuxième corps rotatif (r2) du rapport de vitesses planétaire (17) est relié au deuxième axe entrant.

Système de transmission (1) selon la revendication 1, caractérisé en ce que le rapport de vitesses planétaire n'est pas dans un espace se trouvant entre le carter de transmission (8) et une cloison posée contre le côté extérieur du carter de transmission.

Système de transmission (1) selon la revendication 1 ou 2, caractérisé en ce que les rapports de réduction du rapport de vitesses planétaire (17) et de la transmission (7) sont choisis de telle sorte que la plus basse vitesse en marche avant du système de transmission peut être atteinte en verrouillant le frein (B).

Système de transmission (1) selon la revendication 1, 2 ou 3, caractérisé en ce que le premier et le deuxième corps rotatif (r1,r2) peuvent être directement couplés l'un à l'autre au moyen de l'embrayage (C) et d'un autre embrayage (s) se trouvant en série avec celui-ci, sans l'intervention d'un autre rapport de vitesses.
Système de transmission (1) selon la revendication 4, caractérisé en ce que l'autre embrayage (s) se trouve dans la transmission (7) entre le premier et le deuxième axe entrant (9,11).

Système de transmission (1) selon la revendication 4 ou 5, caractérisé en ce que l'autre embrayage (s) peut directement coupler ensemble le premier et le deuxième axe entrant (9,11) de la transmission (7), sans l'intervention d'un autre rapport de vitesses.

Système de transmission (1) selon la revendication 6, caractérisé en ce qu'il y a un premier embrayage par engrenage (s1) entre le premier axe entrant (9) et l'axe sortant (13) de la transmission (7).
Système de transmission (1) selon la revendication 7, caractérisé en ce que le premier embrayage par engrenage (s1) se trouve entre le premier rapport de vitesses (i1) et l'axe sortant (13).

Système de transmission (1) selon la revendication 7 ou 8, caractérisé en ce qu'il y a un deuxième embrayage par engrenage (s2) entre le deuxième axe entrant (11) et l'axe sortant (13) de la transmission (7).

Système de transmission (1) selon la revendication 9, caractérisé en ce que le deuxième embrayage par engrenage (s2) se trouve entre le deuxième axe entrant (11) et le deuxième rapport de vitesses (i2).

Système de transmission (1) selon la revendication 9 ou 10, caractérisé en ce qu'il y a de plus un troisième rapport de vitesses (i3) et un troisième embrayage par engrenage (s3) entre le premier axe entrant (9) et l'axe sortant (13) de la transmission (7).
Système de transmission (1) selon la revendication 11, caractérisé en ce que le troisième embrayage par engrenage (s3) se trouve entre le troisième rapport de vitesses (i3) et l'axe sortant (13).

Système de transmission (1) selon la revendication 11 ou 12, caractérisé en ce que le deuxième rapport de vitesses (i2) forme la troisième vitesse dans le cas où le troisième corps rotatif (r3) du rapport de vitesses planétaire (17) est freiné et le deuxième embrayage par engrenage (s2) est verrouillé.

Système de transmission (1) selon la revendication 11, 12 ou 13, caractérisé en ce que le premier rapport de vitesses (i1) forme la première vitesse dans le cas où le troisième corps rotatif (r3) du rapport de vitesses planétaire (17) est freiné et l'autre embrayage (s) et le premier embrayage par engrenage (s1) sont verrouillés, et/ou en ce que le premier rapport de vitesses (i1) forme la deuxième vitesse dans le cas où l'embrayage (c) et le premier embrayage par engrenage (s1) sont verrouillés,
et/ou en ce que le troisième rapport de vitesses (i3) forme la quatrième vitesse dans le cas où le troisième corps rotatif (r3) du rapport de vitesses planétaire (17) est freiné et l'autre embrayage (s) et le troisième embrayage par engrenage (s3) sont verrouillés, et/ou en ce que le troisième rapport de vitesses (i3) forme la quatrième vitesse dans le cas où l'embrayage (C) et le troisième embrayage par engrenage (s3) sont verrouillés, et/ou en ce que le troisième rapport de vitesses (i3) forme la cinquième vitesse dans le cas où l'embrayage (C) et le troisième embrayage par engrenage (s3) sont verrouillés.

Système de transmission (1) selon une des revendications précédentes, caractérisé en ce qu'il y a, entre un des axes entrant (9,11) et l'axe sortant (13) de la transmission (7), une vitesse de marche arrière (i4) qui n'inverse pas le sens de rotation entre cet axe entrant et l'axe sortant de la transmission.
